meanings.definition: To transfer ownership or control of a business or industry from the public sector back to private ownership.
meanings.sent1: The government is reprivatizing the state-owned companies to make them privately owned again.
meanings.sent2: After years of public management, the company is reprivatizing to become privately owned once more.
meanings.sent3: The process of reprivatizing the business felt like a game of musical chairs with ownership.
meanings.sent4: Reprivatizing the industry breathed new life into the market competition.
meanings.sent5: The concept of reprivatizing was like giving a business a fresh start.

meanings.definition: The act of returning a previously nationalized entity to private ownership.
meanings.sent1: The reprivatizing of the industry led to increased efficiency and innovation.
meanings.sent2: Many citizens supported the reprivatizing of the company to boost its performance.
meanings.sent3: The reprivatizing of the company was celebrated with a grand ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The reprivatizing of the business was a turning point in its success story.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the reprivatizing of the entity was like watching a phoenix rise from the ashes.
